/* Blu-ray 3D */ - Ref completion/cleanup; reword repeated phrase
/* Future prospects and Market trends */ Capitalization
/* Future prospects and Market trends */ total number of Blu-Ray Disc playback devices sold: this is a figure for U.S.
/* History */ Merging Competition from HD-DVD and end of format war, along with a bit of cleanup.

/* Ongoing development */ /* Ongoing development */ Deleting the dated info about the lack of a joint licensing agreement, as there are now two joint licensing agreements : BD4C and One-Blue. This info could be added in another section, but might no

/* End of the format war and future prospects */
Date maintenance tags and general fixes: build 543:
Reverted back to proper lead since no opposition manifested in talk.
/* HDCP */ Nothing on a Blue-Ray disk is HDCP encrypted, HDCP is an encryption protocol for the HDMI connection, not the disk.

s/8-inch/5-inch in first paragraph cd/dvd/bluray aren't 8 inches

Removed "standard DVD" nonsense. Blu-rays are not DVDs so the notice is inappropriate and misleading.
